result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: General Alcohol Concentration Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Erik O Dyba was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Court ordered a fine of $600.00 in addition to all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

timeConds.notes: With Huber release for treatment. Court allows Good Time Credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erik O Dyba

defendant.name: Dyba, Erik O
defendant.address: 5226 West Willow Road, Brown Deer, WI 53223

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: Defendant's Request for Release Privileges
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Milton L. Childs, Br. 2, for review. spc
Motion to Correct Judgment of Conviction

Statements made by the State, Defense Counsel, and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 3 YEARS with 3 days credit; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.

The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION: 
- 5 MONTHS condition time with Huber release for treatment.  Court allows good time credit.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety. 
- Random urine screens and breathalyzers.
- Provide DNA sample.
- Maintain employment.
- No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. 
- No new law violations arising to the level of probable cause. 
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department. 
- Driver's license revoked for a period of 2 YEARS.
- Ignition interlock device installed for a period of 1 YEAR.


Court ordered a fine of $600.00 in addition to all mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by the end of supervision. Court waived all non-mandatory court costs, fees, and surcharges. 
 Failure to pay shall result in a civil judgment.  Bail on deposit shall be applied.  Any remaining amount shall be returned to poster.
20 day appeal rights given.

Defendant Erik O Dyba in court.  Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner in court for Erik O Dyba.  Attorney Samuel Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin on behalf of Attorney Alexandria S. Carlson. 

Case in court for plea/sentencing.  Parties have reached an agreement.  Plea negotiations set forth on the record and agreed upon by the parties.  Defendant sworn. 

AS TO COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on the motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED OUTRIGHT by operation of law for the purpose of sentencing.  

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon, he may never own or possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Sentencing proceeded.
Received and Filed: Updated Letter from AODA Counselor for sentencing
Received and Filed.
Jury instructions for plea; Received and Filed.
Received and Filed.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Erik O Dyba in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD by Zoom. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Erik O Dyba in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  James C Griffin for Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Held off the record via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erik O Dyba in court with attorney Zachary Hoff for Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Samuel E. Simpson for Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel needs an offer from the State and requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 2.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erik O Dyba in court with Attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner; both appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant previously posted $3,000 cash bail. Court orders $1,000 remain on deposit and the remaining balance of $2,000 be returned to the remitter. 
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No driving without a valid license and state required insurance.

Defendant Erik O Dyba in court with attorney Kevin Michael Gaertner.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
